conclusion: Understand the graph shows position over time in a linear fashion indicating constant velocity.
The graph intersects the y-axis at x = 10 meters when t = 0 seconds.
The slope of the graph will give us the velocity.
The slope m of the line is given by the change in x over the change in t.
The slope m is (10 meters - 0 meters) / (0 seconds - (-2 seconds)) = 10/2 = 5 m/s.
Since the graph is linear, the velocity is constant.
The speed at any time, including the end of the 2nd second, is 5 m/s.
The car's speed at the end of the 2nd second is 5 m/s.
